intro: Koyamacalia dasythyrsa, commonly known as the Hawaiian red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red flowers and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and thrives in sunny, well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom throughout the year, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and protected species in Hawaii.
